It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its distinctive, often colorful mantle and elongated body. The plant, or more accurately, the animal, has a soft, gelatinous body with a prominent, muscular foot used for locomotion. Glyptopleura marginata is also known for its ability to secrete a protective mucus layer, which helps it evade predators.
